description: From on +‎ to, after into. Compare Saterland Frisian antou (“up to”).

entries.meaning: (mathematics, of a function) Assuming each of the values in its codomain; having its range equal to its codomain.
examples: Considered as a function on the real numbers, the exponential function is not onto.

entries.meaning: Arriving upon or on top of (speaking of a physical or metaphorical movement).
examples: My cat just jumped onto the keyboard.
The thought-police were onto my plans of world domination.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Being an onto function with a codomain of (see below).
examples: The exponential function maps the set of real numbers onto the set of positive real numbers.
